intro: Rhynchosia benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguella burrbean, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive fruit structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, spiny pods. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Rhynchosia benguellensis is used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
